column1: Puurs (Dutch pronunciation: [pyːrs]) is a former municipality located in the Belgian province of Antwerp. It is located in the Flemish Region. The municipality comprises the towns of Breendonk
column4: Ruisbroek (old spelling: Ruysbroeck) and Puurs proper. There is also the hamlet of Kalfort. On January 1
column6: Puurs had a total population of 16
column7: 029. The total area is 33.41 km2 (13 sq mi) which gives a population density of 480 inhabitants per km².

column1: Puurs sits about 5 meters above mean sea level. Its geography shows only minor elevation differences (so it's basically flat).

column2: with some low intensity industry development in the North alongside the N16 motorway. However
column3: because of its proximity to the cities of Antwerp and Brussels (both within a 25 km (16 mi) radius) and its excellent accessibility
column4: Puurs is developing increasingly into a residential town.

column2: Puurs and Sint-Amands were merged into the new municipality of Puurs-Sint-Amands.

column1: Signs of habitation dating back to the Iron Age
column2: as well as early Roman and Merovingian times
the Benedictine abbeys of Saint-Cornelimunster of Aachen were the lords of Puurs in the 10th century A.D. In 1278 the municipality was acquired by the Abbey of Sint-Bernard's upon Scheldt
column3: whose property it would remain until the end of the 18th century.

column1: Puurs' Saint-Peter Church is quite large and is hence sometimes referred to as the region's "cathedral". It was built in the 15th century
column2: on the remains of a roman-style church. The baroque-style bell tower was added in the late 17th century. The classical center piece was completed in 1744.

column1: The lands of Kalfort are widely renowned for producing the most delicious asparagus
column2: and at the beginning of summer a festival is held in honour of this "white gold".

column1: The internationally sold Duvel beer is brewed in Breendonk
column2: by the Duvel-Moortgat brewery. Each year in August
column3: a 100 km (62 mi) long foot march called the Dodentocht (Death March) passes by the brewery
column4: and participants and spectators can enjoy Duvel beer for free.

column1: Fort Breendonk was used by the Nazis as a political prison camp. It is kept in its World War II state and is open for visiting. Fort Breendonk and its twin sister Fort Liezele (which now serves as a municipal recreational area) were initially built by the Belgian military just before World War I
column2: as part of a string of fortresses (the Réduit national) designed to protect the approaches to Antwerp. Since 1976
column3: the site of the fort has been part of the municipality of Willebroek.

column1: The Dendermonde-Puurs Steam Railway is a heritage railroad that links up Puurs and Dendermonde. The maintenance road that runs alongside serves as a bicycle track. Bikers can leave the track in Sint-Amands and follow the scenic route up North on the banks of the river Scheldt.
